cards.name: Dromoka's Command
cards.text:
Choose two —
• Prevent all damage target instant or sorcery spell would deal this turn.
• Target player sacrifices an enchantment.
• Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.
• Target creature you control fights target creature you don't control.

rulings.text: Although most instants and sorceries that cause damage to be dealt are the sources of that damage, a few cause other objects to deal damage (for example, spells that cause creatures to fight). The first ability of Dromoka's Command won't prevent damage caused by those other sources.
You can target any player with the second ability, including one that doesn't control an enchantment.
You choose the two modes as you cast the spell. You must choose two different modes. Once modes are chosen, they can't be changed.

You can choose a mode only if you can choose legal targets for that mode. Ignore the targeting requirements for modes that aren't chosen. For example, you can cast Ojutai's Command without targeting a creature spell provided you don't choose the third mode.

As the spell resolves, follow the instructions of the modes you chose in the order they are printed on the card. For example, if you chose the second and fourth modes of Ojutai's Command, you would gain 4 life and then draw a card. (The order won't matter in most cases.)
If a Command is copied, the effect that creates the copy will usually allow you to choose new targets for the copy, but you can't choose new modes.

If all targets for the chosen modes become illegal before the Command resolves, the spell won't resolve and none of its effects will happen. If at least one target is still legal, the spell will resolve but will have no effect on any illegal targets.

cards.originalText:
Choose two —
• Prevent all damage target instant or sorcery spell would deal this turn.
• Target player sacrifices an enchantment.
• Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.
• Target creature you control fights target creature you don't control.

cards.name: Enduring Scalelord
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever one or more +1/+1 counters are put on another creature you control, you may put a +1/+1 counter on Enduring Scalelord.
cards.flavor: Only the sun that beats down upon Arashin's walls could shine more brightly.

rulings.text: A creature entering the battlefield with one or more +1/+1 counters on it will cause Enduring Scalelord's ability to trigger.
If +1/+1 counters are put on multiple creatures you control (other than Enduring Scalelord) at the same time, Enduring Scalelord's ability will trigger once for each of those creatures.

If you control two Enduring Scalelords, putting a +1/+1 counter on one of them will cause the ability of the other one to trigger. When this ability resolves, you'll put a +1/+1 counter on the other Scalelord. This will cause the ability of the first one to trigger. This loop will repeat until you choose not to put a +1/+1 counter on one of the Enduring Scalelords.

cards.originalText:
Flying
Whenever one or more +1/+1 counters are placed on another creature you control, you may put a +1/+1 counter on Enduring Scalelord.

cards.name: Harbinger of the Hunt
cards.text:
Flying
{2}{R}: Harbinger of the Hunt deals 1 damage to each creature without flying.
{2}{G}: Harbinger of the Hunt deals 1 damage to each other creature with flying.
cards.flavor: An Atarka dragon's exhale cooks what its inhale consumes.

rulings.text: If Harbinger of the Hunt loses flying, its first activated ability will cause it to deal damage to itself.

cards.originalText:
Flying
{2}{R}: Harbinger of the Hunt deals 1 damage to each creature without flying.
{2}{G}: Harbinger of the Hunt deals 1 damage to each other creature with flying.

cards.name: Kolaghan's Command
cards.text:
Choose two —
• Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
• Target player discards a card.
• Destroy target artifact.
• Kolaghan's Command deals 2 damage to any target.

rulings.text: You choose the two modes as you cast the spell. You must choose two different modes. Once modes are chosen, they can't be changed.

You can choose a mode only if you can choose legal targets for that mode. Ignore the targeting requirements for modes that aren't chosen. For example, you can cast Ojutai's Command without targeting a creature spell provided you don't choose the third mode.

As the spell resolves, follow the instructions of the modes you chose in the order they are printed on the card. For example, if you chose the second and fourth modes of Ojutai's Command, you would gain 4 life and then draw a card. (The order won't matter in most cases.)
If a Command is copied, the effect that creates the copy will usually allow you to choose new targets for the copy, but you can't choose new modes.

If all targets for the chosen modes become illegal before the Command resolves, the spell won't resolve and none of its effects will happen. If at least one target is still legal, the spell will resolve but will have no effect on any illegal targets.

cards.originalText:
Choose two —
• Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
• Target player discards a card.
• Destroy target artifact.
• Kolaghan's Command deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Narset Transcendent
cards.text:
+1: Look at the top card of your library. If it's a noncreature, nonland card, you may reveal it and put it into your hand.
−2: When you cast your next instant or sorcery spell from your hand this turn, it gains rebound.
−9: You get an emblem with "Your opponents can't cast noncreature spells."

rulings.text: When resolving Narset's first ability, if the top card of your library is a creature or a land card, or if you don't wish to put it into your hand, it isn't revealed.
If a spell that exiles itself as part of its own resolution, such as Volcanic Vision, gains rebound, the ability that lets you cast the spell again won't be created. The spell will simply be exiled.

cards.originalText:
+1: Look at the top card of your library. If it's a noncreature, nonland card, you may reveal it and put it into your hand.
−2: When you cast your next instant or sorcery spell from your hand this turn, it gains rebound.
−9: You get an emblem with "Your opponents can't cast noncreature spells."

cards.name: Necromaster Dragon
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Necromaster Dragon deals combat damage to a player, you may pay {2}. If you do, create a 2/2 black Zombie creature token and each opponent puts the top two cards of their library into their graveyard.

rulings.text: Necromaster Dragon's last ability will trigger once for each player it deals combat damage to. For each of these abilities, you may pay {2} only once.

cards.originalText:
Flying
Whenever Necromaster Dragon deals combat damage to a player, you may pay {2}. If you do, put a 2/2 black Zombie creature token onto the battlefield and each opponent puts the top two cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

cards.name: Ojutai's Command
cards.text:
Choose two —
• Return target creature card with converted mana cost 2 or less from your graveyard to the battlefield.
• You gain 4 life.
• Counter target creature spell.
• Draw a card.

rulings.text: You choose the two modes as you cast the spell. You must choose two different modes. Once modes are chosen, they can't be changed.

You can choose a mode only if you can choose legal targets for that mode. Ignore the targeting requirements for modes that aren't chosen. For example, you can cast Ojutai's Command without targeting a creature spell provided you don't choose the third mode.

As the spell resolves, follow the instructions of the modes you chose in the order they are printed on the card. For example, if you chose the second and fourth modes of Ojutai's Command, you would gain 4 life and then draw a card. (The order won't matter in most cases.)
If a Command is copied, the effect that creates the copy will usually allow you to choose new targets for the copy, but you can't choose new modes.

If all targets for the chosen modes become illegal before the Command resolves, the spell won't resolve and none of its effects will happen. If at least one target is still legal, the spell will resolve but will have no effect on any illegal targets.

cards.originalText:
Choose two —
• Return target creature card with converted mana cost 2 or less from your graveyard to the battlefield.
• You gain 4 life.
• Counter target creature spell.
• Draw a card.

cards.name: Pristine Skywise
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, untap Pristine Skywise. It gains protection from the color of your choice until end of turn.
cards.flavor: The elite of Ojutai's brood, the skywise see their enemies as puzzles to be solved.
cards.originalText:
Flying
Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, untap Pristine Skywise. It gains protection from the color of your choice until end of turn.

cards.name: Ruthless Deathfang
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever you sacrifice a creature, target opponent sacrifices a creature.
cards.flavor:
"Bring forth the dead, their skull-grins and rattle-bones. We will feast upon their wailing ghosts."
—Silumgar, translated from Draconic

rulings.text: Ruthless Deathfang's triggered ability will trigger whenever you sacrifice any creature, including Ruthless Deathfang itself. It will trigger whenever you sacrifice a creature for any reason, including to pay a cost or as the result of a spell or ability (such as an opposing Ruthless Deathfang's ability).
Notably, the "legend rule" does not cause any permanents to be sacrificed. They are simply put into their owners' graveyards.

cards.originalText:
Flying
Whenever you sacrifice a creature, target opponent sacrifices a creature.

cards.name: Sarkhan Unbroken
cards.text:
+1: Draw a card, then add one mana of any color.
−2: Create a 4/4 red Dragon creature token with flying.
−8: Search your library for any number of Dragon creature cards and put them onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
cards.originalText:
+1: Draw a card, then add one mana of any color to your mana pool.
−2: Put a 4/4 red Dragon creature token with flying onto the battlefield.
−8: Search your library for any number of Dragon creature cards and put them onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Savage Ventmaw
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Savage Ventmaw attacks, add {R}{R}{R}{G}{G}{G}. Until end of turn, you don't lose this mana as steps and phases end.

rulings.text: This mana won't empty from your mana pool as steps and phases end for the remainder of the turn even if Savage Ventmaw leaves the battlefield during the turn.

cards.originalText:
Flying
Whenever Savage Ventmaw attacks, add {R}{R}{R}{G}{G}{G} to your mana pool. Until end of turn, this mana doesn't empty from your mana pool as steps and phases end.

cards.name: Silumgar's Command
cards.text:
Choose two —
• Counter target noncreature spell.
• Return target permanent to its owner's hand.
• Target creature gets -3/-3 until end of turn.
• Destroy target planeswalker.

rulings.text: You choose the two modes as you cast the spell. You must choose two different modes. Once modes are chosen, they can't be changed.

You can choose a mode only if you can choose legal targets for that mode. Ignore the targeting requirements for modes that aren't chosen. For example, you can cast Ojutai's Command without targeting a creature spell provided you don't choose the third mode.

As the spell resolves, follow the instructions of the modes you chose in the order they are printed on the card. For example, if you chose the second and fourth modes of Ojutai's Command, you would gain 4 life and then draw a card. (The order won't matter in most cases.)
If a Command is copied, the effect that creates the copy will usually allow you to choose new targets for the copy, but you can't choose new modes.

If all targets for the chosen modes become illegal before the Command resolves, the spell won't resolve and none of its effects will happen. If at least one target is still legal, the spell will resolve but will have no effect on any illegal targets.

cards.originalText:
Choose two —
• Counter target noncreature spell.
• Return target permanent to its owner's hand.
• Target creature gets -3/-3 until end of turn.
• Destroy target planeswalker.

cards.name: Swift Warkite
cards.text:
Flying
When Swift Warkite enters the battlefield, you may put a creature card with converted mana cost 3 or less from your hand or graveyard onto the battlefield. That creature gains haste. Return it to your hand at the beginning of the next end step.

rulings.text: You can't put creatures onto the battlefield face down this way.

The creature you put onto the battlefield will be returned to your hand only if it's still on the battlefield as the delayed triggered ability resolves during the next end step. If it leaves the battlefield before then, it will remain wherever it is.
The delayed triggered ability that returns the creature to your hand will trigger even if Swift Warkite leaves the battlefield before the next end step.

cards.originalText:
Flying
When Swift Warkite enters the battlefield, you may put a creature card with converted mana cost 3 or less from your hand or graveyard onto the battlefield. That creature gains haste. Return it to your hand at the beginning of the next end step.

cards.name: Ancestral Statue
cards.text: When Ancestral Statue enters the battlefield, return a nonland permanent you control to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: The mage awakened the statue in hopes of learning the lost lore of her clan, but the statue was interested only in war.

rulings.text: Ancestral Statue's ability is mandatory. If Ancestral Statue is the only nonland permanent you control when its ability resolves, you must return it to its owner's hand.
The triggered ability doesn't target any permanent. You choose which one to return as the ability resolves. No player can respond to this choice once the ability starts resolving.

cards.originalText: When Ancestral Statue enters the battlefield, return a nonland permanent you control to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Atarka Monument
cards.text:
{T}: Add {R} or {G}.
{4}{R}{G}: Atarka Monument becomes a 4/4 red and green Dragon artifact creature with flying until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Atarka is worshipped and fed by her subjects at Ayagor, the Dragon's Bowl.

rulings.text: A Monument can't attack on the turn it enters the battlefield.
Each Monument is colorless, although the last ability will make each of them two colors until end of turn.

If a Monument has any +1/+1 counters on it, those counters will remain on the permanent after it stops being a creature. Those counters will have no effect as long as the Monument isn't a creature, but they will apply again if the Monument later becomes a creature.

Activating the last ability of a Monument while it's already a creature will override any effects that set its power or toughness to a specific value. Effects that modify power or toughness without directly setting them to a specific value will continue to apply.

cards.originalText:
{T}: Add {R} or {G} to your mana pool.
{4}{R}{G}: Atarka Monument becomes a 4/4 red and green Dragon artifact creature with flying until end of turn.

cards.name: Custodian of the Trove
cards.text:
Defender
Custodian of the Trove enters the battlefield tapped.
cards.flavor: Silumgar delights in repurposing the treasures of other clans to serve his own ravenous greed.
cards.originalText:
Defender
Custodian of the Trove enters the battlefield tapped.

cards.name: Dragonloft Idol
cards.text: As long as you control a Dragon, Dragonloft Idol gets +1/+1 and has flying and trample.
cards.flavor: The idols were forged during the time of the Khanfall, when the dragons came to rule Tarkir and its people aligned themselves with the five dragonlords.
cards.originalText: As long as you control a Dragon, Dragonloft Idol gets +1/+1 and has flying and trample.

cards.name: Dromoka Monument
cards.text:
{T}: Add {G} or {W}.
{4}{G}{W}: Dromoka Monument becomes a 4/4 green and white Dragon artifact creature with flying until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Dromoka rules her clan from the Great Aerie atop Arashin, the central city of the Shifting Wastes.

rulings.text: A Monument can't attack on the turn it enters the battlefield.
Each Monument is colorless, although the last ability will make each of them two colors until end of turn.

If a Monument has any +1/+1 counters on it, those counters will remain on the permanent after it stops being a creature. Those counters will have no effect as long as the Monument isn't a creature, but they will apply again if the Monument later becomes a creature.

Activating the last ability of a Monument while it's already a creature will override any effects that set its power or toughness to a specific value. Effects that modify power or toughness without directly setting them to a specific value will continue to apply.

cards.originalText:
{T}: Add {G} or {W} to your mana pool.
{4}{G}{W}: Dromoka Monument becomes a 4/4 green and white Dragon artifact creature with flying until end of turn.

cards.name: Gate Smasher

rulings.text: Gate Smasher's equip ability can target any creature. However, if that creature's toughness is 3 or less as the equip ability resolves, Gate Smasher won't become attached to it.
If Gate Smasher is attached to a creature whose toughness falls below 4, Gate Smasher will become unattached as a state-based action.

cards.name: Keeper of the Lens
cards.text: You may look at face-down creatures you don't control. (You may do this at any time.)
cards.flavor:
"It sees all, but it reveals what it sees only to a chosen few."
—Taigam, Ojutai master

rulings.text: Keeper of the Lens allows you to look at face-down creatures you don't control whenever you want to, even if you don't have priority. This action doesn't use the stack.
Keeper of the Lens doesn't stop your opponents from looking at face-down creatures they control.
Keeper of the Lens doesn't let you look at other players' face-down spells while they're on the stack.

cards.originalText: You may look at face-down creatures you don't control. (You may do this at any time.)

cards.name: Kolaghan Monument
cards.text:
{T}: Add {B} or {R}.
{4}{B}{R}: Kolaghan Monument becomes a 4/4 black and red Dragon artifact creature with flying until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Kolaghan has no lasting home, but her disciples leave relics to mark her conquests.

rulings.text: A Monument can't attack on the turn it enters the battlefield.
Each Monument is colorless, although the last ability will make each of them two colors until end of turn.

If a Monument has any +1/+1 counters on it, those counters will remain on the permanent after it stops being a creature. Those counters will have no effect as long as the Monument isn't a creature, but they will apply again if the Monument later becomes a creature.

cards.originalText:
{T}: Add {B} or {R} to your mana pool.
{4}{B}{R}: Kolaghan Monument becomes a 4/4 black and red Dragon artifact creature with flying until end of turn.

cards.name: Ojutai Monument
cards.text:
{T}: Add {W} or {U}.
{4}{W}{U}: Ojutai Monument becomes a 4/4 white and blue Dragon artifact creature with flying until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Ojutai spends time at all his strongholds, but he most favors Cori Stronghold for his meditation.

rulings.text: A Monument can't attack on the turn it enters the battlefield.
Each Monument is colorless, although the last ability will make each of them two colors until end of turn.

If a Monument has any +1/+1 counters on it, those counters will remain on the permanent after it stops being a creature. Those counters will have no effect as long as the Monument isn't a creature, but they will apply again if the Monument later becomes a creature.

cards.name: Silumgar Monument
cards.text:
{T}: Add {U} or {B}.
{4}{U}{B}: Silumgar Monument becomes a 4/4 blue and black Dragon artifact creature with flying until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Silumgar dominates his clan from a fortress on the Marang River, where he rests upon piles of treasure.

rulings.text: A Monument can't attack on the turn it enters the battlefield.
Each Monument is colorless, although the last ability will make each of them two colors until end of turn.

If a Monument has any +1/+1 counters on it, those counters will remain on the permanent after it stops being a creature. Those counters will have no effect as long as the Monument isn't a creature, but they will apply again if the Monument later becomes a creature.

{T}: Add {U} or {B} to your mana pool.
{4}{U}{B}: Silumgar Monument becomes a 4/4 blue and black Dragon artifact creature with flying until end of turn.

cards.name: Spidersilk Net
cards.text:
Equipped creature gets +0/+2 and has reach. (It can block creatures with flying.)
Equip {2} ({2}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)
cards.flavor: "Dragons are our betters, but we will fight them if our dragonlord orders it."
cards.originalText:
Equipped creature gets +0/+2 and has reach. (It can block creatures with flying.)
Equip {2} ({2}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)

cards.name: Stormrider Rig

rulings.text: If the creature that entered the battlefield is no longer on the battlefield as Stormrider Rig's second ability resolves, Stormrider Rig doesn't move. This is also true if that creature can't legally be equipped by Stormrider Rig.

cards.name: Tapestry of the Ages
cards.text: {2}, {T}: Draw a card. Activate this ability only if you've cast a noncreature spell this turn.
cards.flavor:
"Abzan, Jeskai, Sultai, Mardu, Temur—names lost to history, yet worthy of further study."
—Narset
cards.originalText: {2}, {T}: Draw a card. Activate this ability only if you've cast a noncreature spell this turn.

cards.name: Vial of Dragonfire
cards.text: {2}, {T}, Sacrifice Vial of Dragonfire: It deals 2 damage to target creature.
cards.flavor: Designed by an ancient artificer, the vials are strong enough to hold the very breath of a dragon—until it's needed.
cards.originalText: {2}, {T}, Sacrifice Vial of Dragonfire: Vial of Dragonfire deals 2 damage to target creature.

cards.name: Evolving Wilds
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice Evolving Wilds: Search your library for a basic land card, put it onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: The land is ever resilient. Should it die, it will be reborn.
cards.originalText: {T}, Sacrifice Evolving Wilds: Search your library for a basic land card and put it onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Haven of the Spirit Dragon
cards.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{T}: Add one mana of any color. Spend this mana only to cast a Dragon creature spell.
{2}, {T}, Sacrifice Haven of the Spirit Dragon: Return target Dragon creature card or Ugin planeswalker card from your graveyard to your hand.

rulings.text: The mana produced by Haven of the Spirit Dragon's second ability can be used to pay for any additional or alternative costs (such as dash costs) involved in casting a Dragon creature spell.

cards.originalText:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool. Spend this mana only to cast a Dragon creature spell.
{2}, {T}, Sacrifice Haven of the Spirit Dragon: Return target Dragon creature card or Ugin planeswalker card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Auriok Glaivemaster
cards.text: As long as Auriok Glaivemaster is equipped, it gets +1/+1 and has first strike.
cards.flavor: "Give me a bit of steel and I'll deliver it into the hearts of my enemies."

foreignNames.name: オーリオックの長刀使い

cards.originalText: As long as Auriok Glaivemaster is equipped, it gets +1/+1 and has first strike.

cards.name: Echoing Calm
cards.text: Destroy target enchantment and all other enchantments with the same name as that enchantment.
cards.flavor: A single light unleashes a hail of cleansing.
cards.originalText: Destroy target enchantment and all other enchantments with the same name as that enchantment.

cards.name: Emissary of Hope
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Emissary of Hope deals combat damage to a player, you gain 1 life for each artifact that player controls.
cards.originalText:
Flying
Whenever Emissary of Hope deals combat damage to a player, you gain 1 life for each artifact that player controls.

cards.name: Hallow
cards.text: Prevent all damage target spell would deal this turn. You gain life equal to the damage prevented this way.
cards.flavor: "Bend with the storm, then reply in kind."
cards.originalText: Prevent all damage target spell would deal this turn. You gain life equal to the damage prevented this way.

cards.name: Leonin Battlemage
cards.text:
{T}: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
Whenever you cast a spell, you may untap Leonin Battlemage.
cards.flavor: The strongest of the pride are measured not by the steel in their hands but by the steel in their souls.

foreignNames.name: レオニンの戦闘魔道士

cards.originalText:
{T}: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn. 
Whenever you play a spell, you may untap Leonin Battlemage.

cards.name: Leonin Shikari
cards.text: You may activate equip abilities any time you could cast an instant.
cards.flavor: Her instinct is as sharp as her blade.

rulings.text: An equip ability uses the keyword ability "equip." Normally, equip abilities can be activated only any time you could cast a sorcery.
Leonin Shikari allows you to move your Equipment around during the combat phase or in response to a spell or ability. You're still subject to any other restrictions on activating equip abilities.

cards.originalText: You may play equip abilities any time you could play an instant.

cards.name: Loxodon Mystic
cards.text: {W}, {T}: Tap target creature.
cards.flavor: As the nim storm across the plains, a lone priest stands in their path. At his silent gesture, the battle line breaks, and the tide turns.
cards.originalText: {W}, {T}: Tap target creature.

cards.name: Metal Fatigue
cards.text: Tap all artifacts.
cards.flavor: The Auriok have fought the metal hordes for so long now that knowing how to cripple them has become an instinct.
cards.originalText: Tap all artifacts.

cards.name: Pristine Angel
cards.text:
Flying
As long as Pristine Angel is untapped, it has protection from artifacts and from all colors.
Whenever you cast a spell, you may untap Pristine Angel.
cards.originalText:
Flying
As long as Pristine Angel is untapped, it has protection from artifacts and from all colors.
Whenever you play a spell, you may untap Pristine Angel.

cards.name: Pteron Ghost
cards.text:
Flying
Sacrifice Pteron Ghost: Regenerate target artifact.
cards.flavor: Defending to the death isn't always enough.
cards.originalText:
Flying
Sacrifice Pteron Ghost: Regenerate target artifact.

cards.name: Pulse of the Fields
cards.text: You gain 4 life. Then if an opponent has more life than you, return Pulse of the Fields to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: Before religion or civilization, there was order.
cards.originalText: You gain 4 life. Then if an opponent has more life than you, return Pulse of the Fields to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Purge
cards.text: Destroy target artifact creature or black creature. It can't be regenerated.
cards.flavor: For the first and last time, the horrific creature experienced terror.
cards.originalText: Destroy target artifact creature or black creature. It can't be regenerated.

cards.name: Ritual of Restoration
cards.text: Return target artifact card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: Leonin raising ceremonies take place at the white sun's dawn, the rebirth of artifacts mirroring the birth of a new day.
cards.originalText: Return target artifact card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Soulscour
cards.text: Destroy all nonartifact permanents.
cards.flavor:
"I have seen the end of times, a future in which all our kind are torn from this world."
—Ushanti, leonin shaman
cards.originalText: Destroy all nonartifact permanents.

cards.name: Steelshaper Apprentice
cards.text: {W}, {T}, Return Steelshaper Apprentice to its owner's hand: Search your library for an Equipment card, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: Theirs is a craft brought about by necessity, now raised to the level of art.
cards.originalText: {W}, {T}, Return Steelshaper Apprentice to its owner's hand: Search your library for an Equipment card, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Stir the Pride
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Creatures you control get +2/+2 until end of turn.
• Until end of turn, creatures you control gain "Whenever this creature deals damage, you gain that much life."
Entwine {1}{W} (Choose both if you pay the entwine cost.)

rulings.text: Only creatures you control when Stir the Pride resolves will get the bonuses.

Notably, the ability granted by the second mode isn't lifelink. It's a triggered ability that triggers whenever the creature with that ability deals damage. If that creature also has lifelink, you'll gain life as a result of that damage and also when the triggered ability resolves. Multiple instances of this ability trigger separately.

cards.originalText:
Choose one Creatures you control get +2/+2 until end of turn; or until end of turn, creatures you control gain "Whenever this creature deals damage, you gain that much life."
Entwine {1}{W} (Choose both if you pay the entwine cost.)

cards.name: Test of Faith
cards.text: Prevent the next 3 damage that would be dealt to target creature this turn. For each 1 damage prevented this way, put a +1/+1 counter on that creature.
cards.flavor: Those who survive the test bear a mark of power anyone can recognize.

rulings.text: The +1/+1 counters are put onto the creature at the same time the damage is prevented. If a 1/1 creature would be dealt 6 damage, 3 damage is prevented and three +1/+1 counters are put on the creature. The creature ends up as a 4/4 creature with 3 damage marked on it.

cards.originalText: Prevent the next 3 damage that would be dealt to target creature this turn, and put a +1/+1 counter on that creature for each 1 damage prevented this way.

cards.name: Turn the Tables
cards.text: All combat damage that would be dealt to you this turn is dealt to target attacking creature instead.
cards.flavor: "Your arrogance is my best weapon."

rulings.text: If the targeted creature isn't on the battlefield when the combat damage would be dealt, the damage isn't redirected.
If the targeted creature has been removed from combat but is still on the battlefield, the damage will be redirected.

cards.originalText: All combat damage that would be dealt to you this turn is dealt to target attacking creature instead.

cards.name: Carry Away
cards.text:
Enchant Equipment
When Carry Away enters the battlefield, unattach enchanted Equipment.
You control enchanted Equipment.
cards.flavor: Stealing goblin weapons would be easier if the goblins were smart enough to let go.

rulings.text: Normally, gaining control of an Equipment doesn't change what it's attached to. However, Carry Away has a triggered ability that unattaches the Equipment from whatever it's attached to. The Equipment's new controller can activate its equip ability to move it onto a creature they control.

cards.originalText:
When Carry Away comes into play, unattach enchanted Equipment.
You control enchanted Equipment.

cards.name: Chromescale Drake
cards.text:
Affinity for artifacts (This spell costs {1} less to cast for each artifact you control.)
Flying
When Chromescale Drake enters the battlefield, reveal the top three cards of your library. Put all artifact cards revealed this way into your hand and the rest into your graveyard.
cards.originalText:
Affinity for artifacts (This spell costs {1} less to play for each artifact you control.)
Flying
When Chromescale Drake comes into play, reveal the top three cards of your library. Put all artifact cards revealed this way into your hand and the rest into your graveyard.

cards.name: Echoing Truth
cards.text: Return target nonland permanent and all other permanents with the same name as that permanent to their owners' hands.
cards.flavor: A single lie unleashes a tide of disbelief.
cards.originalText: Return target nonland permanent and all other permanents with the same name as that permanent to their owners' hands.

cards.name: Hoverguard Observer
cards.text:
Flying
Hoverguard Observer can block only creatures with flying.
cards.flavor: It could be made to run silently, but its low hum reminds the Neurok that they are always watched.
cards.originalText:
Flying
Hoverguard Observer can block only creatures with flying.

cards.name: Last Word
cards.text:
This spell can't be countered.
Counter target spell.
cards.flavor: "Someday, someone will best me. But it won't be today, and it won't be you."
cards.originalText:
Last Word can't be countered by spells or abilities.
Counter target spell.

cards.name: Machinate
cards.text: Look at the top X cards of your library, where X is the number of artifacts you control. Put one of those cards into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.
cards.flavor: As long as there are questions to be asked, the vedalken will ask them.
cards.originalText: Look at the top X cards of your library, where X is the number of artifacts you control. Put one of those cards into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.

cards.name: Magnetic Flux
cards.text: Artifact creatures you control gain flying until end of turn.
cards.flavor: After the researcher's astonishing success, his assistants spent six hours finding a way to return the specimens safely to the ground.
cards.originalText: Artifact creatures you control gain flying until end of turn.

cards.name: Neurok Prodigy
cards.text:
Flying
Discard an artifact card: Return Neurok Prodigy to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: "Why should I be bound by rules when I can see so far beyond them?"
cards.originalText:
Flying
Discard an artifact card from your hand: Return Neurok Prodigy to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Neurok Transmuter
cards.text:
{U}: Target creature becomes an artifact in addition to its other types until end of turn.
{U}: Until end of turn, target artifact creature becomes blue and isn't an artifact.

rulings.text: Neurok Transmuter's second ability removes the type "artifact" — and any artifact subtypes — from the artifact creature it targets. It doesn't remove any other types or any subtypes of other types, and it doesn't remove supertypes. If the artifact was legendary, it's still legendary, and the "Legend rule" applies normally.
Equipment that stops being an artifact loses the subtype "Equipment." Permanents without the subtype Equipment can't equip creatures. Of course, artifact creatures can't equip anything either.

Neurok Transmuter's second ability interacts strangely with March of the Machines from the Mirrodin set. If an artifact is an artifact creature only because March of the Machines is on the battlefield and you then activate Neurok Transmuter's second ability on that artifact creature, the result is a permanent with no types whatsoever. Neurok Transmuter's ability removes the type "artifact." March of the Machines depends on knowing what is and isn't an artifact. The permanent won't be an artifact when March of the Machine's effect is applied and therefore it won't be turned into a creature.

foreignNames.name: ニューロックの変成者

cards.originalText:
{U}: Target creature becomes an artifact in addition to its other types until end of turn.
{U}: Until end of turn, target artifact creature becomes blue and isn't an artifact.

cards.name: Psychic Overload
cards.text:
Enchant permanent
When Psychic Overload enters the battlefield, tap enchanted permanent.
Enchanted permanent doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.
Enchanted permanent has "Discard two artifact cards: Untap this permanent."
cards.originalText:
When Psychic Overload comes into play, tap enchanted permanent.
Enchanted permanent doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.
Enchanted permanent has "Discard two artifact cards from your hand: Untap this permanent."

cards.name: Pulse of the Grid
cards.text: Draw two cards, then discard a card. Then if an opponent has more cards in hand than you, return Pulse of the Grid to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: Before labs or lectures, there was insight.
cards.originalText: Draw two cards, then discard a card from your hand. Then if an opponent has more cards in hand than you, return Pulse of the Grid to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Quicksilver Behemoth
cards.text:
Affinity for artifacts (This spell costs {1} less to cast for each artifact you control.)
When Quicksilver Behemoth attacks or blocks, return it to its owner's hand at end of combat. (Return it only if it's on the battlefield.)
cards.originalText:
Affinity for artifacts (This spell costs {1} less to play for each artifact you control.)
When Quicksilver Behemoth attacks or blocks, return it to its owner's hand at end of combat. (Return it only if it's in play.)

cards.name: Reshape
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice an artifact.
Search your library for an artifact card with converted mana cost X or less and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor:
"Today's paperweight, tomorrow's leveler."
—Bruenna, Neurok leader
cards.originalText:
As an additional cost to play Reshape, sacrifice an artifact.
Search your library for an artifact card with converted mana cost X or less and put it into play. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Retract
cards.text: Return all artifacts you control to their owner's hand.
cards.flavor:
"Secrets are meant to remain secret."
—Memnarch
cards.originalText: Return all artifacts you control to their owner's hand.

cards.name: Second Sight
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Look at the top five cards of target opponent's library, then put them back in any order.
• Look at the top five cards of your library, then put them back in any order.
Entwine {U} (Choose both if you pay the entwine cost.)
cards.originalText:
Choose one Look at the top five cards of target opponent's library, then put them back in any order; or look at the top five cards of your library, then put them back in any order.
Entwine {U} (Choose both if you pay the entwine cost.)

cards.name: Synod Artificer
cards.text:
{X}, {T}: Tap X target noncreature artifacts.
{X}, {T}: Untap X target noncreature artifacts.
cards.flavor: Memnarch shared a touch of his power with the vedalken in return for their service. It is a debt he intends to collect.
cards.originalText:
{X}, {T}: Tap X target noncreature artifacts.
{X}, {T}: Untap X target noncreature artifacts.

cards.name: Vedalken Engineer
cards.text: {T}: Add two mana of any one color. Spend this mana only to cast artifact spells or activate abilities of artifacts.
cards.flavor: Art is unknown to the vedalken—for them, all creations must serve a purpose.

foreignNames.name: ヴィダルケンの技術者

cards.originalText: {T}: Add two mana of any one color to your mana pool. Spend this mana only to play artifact spells or activated abilities of artifacts.

cards.name: Vex
cards.text: Counter target spell. That spell's controller may draw a card.
cards.flavor:
"The druids would be better off if they spent more time in the lab and less time watching trees grow."
—Pontifex, elder researcher
cards.originalText: Counter target spell. That spell's controller may draw a card.

cards.name: Aether Snap
cards.text: Remove all counters from all permanents and exile all tokens.
cards.flavor:
"May you wake to find you were only ever a dream."
—Mephidross curse

rulings.text: Aether Snap removes all counters from permanents, no matter what kind they are.
Counters on objects that aren't permanents, such as time counters on a suspended card or poison counters on a player, are unaffected by Aether Snap.

cards.originalText: Remove all counters from all permanents and remove all tokens from the game.

cards.name: Burden of Greed
cards.text: Target player loses 1 life for each tapped artifact they control.
cards.flavor:
"The one who dies with the most toys is still dead."
—Geth, keeper of the Vault
cards.originalText: Target player loses 1 life for each tapped artifact he or she controls.

cards.name: Chittering Rats
cards.text: When Chittering Rats enters the battlefield, target opponent puts a card from their hand on top of their library.
cards.flavor: Bottom feeders sometimes rise to the top.
cards.originalText: When Chittering Rats comes into play, target opponent puts a card from his or her hand on top of his or her library.

cards.name: Death Cloud
cards.text: Each player loses X life, discards X cards, sacrifices X creatures, then sacrifices X lands.
cards.flavor: The swarm's million wings stir the foulest of breezes.

rulings.text: If you control a permanent that's a creature and a land, and you choose to sacrifice it as you sacrifice creatures, it won't be on the battlefield when you sacrifice lands. You can't sacrifice it again.

cards.originalText: Each player loses X life, then discards X cards from his or her hand, then sacrifices X creatures, then sacrifices X lands.

cards.name: Echoing Decay
cards.text: Target creature and all other creatures with the same name as that creature get -2/-2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: A single fear unleashes a torrent of nightmares.
cards.originalText: Target creature and all other creatures with the same name as that creature get -2/-2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Emissary of Despair
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Emissary of Despair deals combat damage to a player, that player loses 1 life for each artifact they control.
cards.originalText:
Flying
Whenever Emissary of Despair deals combat damage to a player, that player loses 1 life for each artifact he or she controls.

cards.name: Essence Drain
cards.text: Essence Drain deals 3 damage to any target and you gain 3 life.
cards.flavor: Mephidross claims all life within it. What cannot be twisted is absorbed.

rulings.text: If the target permanent or player is an illegal target when Essence Drain tries to resolve, it won't resolve and none of its effects will happen. You won't gain 3 life.

cards.originalText: Essence Drain deals 3 damage to target creature or player and you gain 3 life.

cards.name: Greater Harvester
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice a permanent.
Whenever Greater Harvester deals combat damage to a player, that player sacrifices two permanents.
cards.originalText:
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice a permanent.
Whenever Greater Harvester deals combat damage to a player, that player sacrifices two permanents.

cards.name: Grimclaw Bats
cards.text:
Flying
{B}, Pay 1 life: Grimclaw Bats gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Even on a world of metal, there are those who thirst for blood.
cards.originalText:
Flying
{B}, Pay 1 life: Grimclaw Bats gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Hunger of the Nim
cards.text: Target creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn for each artifact you control.
cards.flavor: Their pain is so great, they can't help but share it with others.
cards.originalText: Target creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn for each artifact you control.

cards.name: Mephitic Ooze
cards.text:
Mephitic Ooze gets +1/+0 for each artifact you control.
Whenever Mephitic Ooze deals combat damage to a creature, destroy that creature. The creature can't be regenerated.
cards.flavor: In Mephidross, refuse doesn't last long—it's all scavenged, reanimated, or consumed.
cards.originalText:
Mephitic Ooze gets +1/+0 for each artifact you control.
Whenever Mephitic Ooze deals combat damage to a creature, destroy that creature. The creature can't be regenerated.

cards.name: Murderous Spoils
cards.text: Destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated. You gain control of all Equipment that were attached to it. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)
cards.flavor: Scavengers are always the first to pay their respects.
cards.originalText: Destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated. You gain control of all Equipment that was attached to it. (This effect doesn't end at end of turn.)

cards.name: Nim Abomination
cards.text: At the beginning of your end step, if Nim Abomination is untapped, you lose 3 life.
cards.flavor: It is one of the oldest nim, steeped so long in the Dross that it has lost all vestiges of humanity.
cards.originalText: At the end of your turn, if Nim Abomination is untapped, you lose 3 life.

cards.name: Pulse of the Dross
cards.text: Target player reveals three cards from their hand and you choose one of them. That player discards that card. Then if that player has more cards in hand than you, return Pulse of the Dross to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: Before tyrants or torturers, there was evil.
cards.originalText: Target player reveals three cards from his or her hand and you choose one of them. That player discards that card. Then if that player has more cards in hand than you, return Pulse of the Dross to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Scavenging Scarab
cards.text: Scavenging Scarab can't block.
cards.flavor: The beetles feed not on the flesh of corpses but on the metal, grinding out the iron and steel to add to their own bulky shells.
cards.originalText: Scavenging Scarab can't block.

cards.name: Screams from Within
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets -1/-1.
When enchanted creature dies, return Screams from Within from your graveyard to the battlefield.
cards.flavor: There's no escaping an enemy that lives inside your head.

rulings.text: If another player has gained control of Screams from Within, its triggered ability does nothing when it's put into a graveyard. Cards are always put into their owner's graveyard, but Screams from Within's ability looks for the card only in its controller's graveyard.

If Screams from Within returns to the battlefield from your graveyard, you choose the creature that Screams from Within enchants (just as you would for any Aura that you're putting onto the battlefield without casting it). If your opponent doesn't control any creatures, you must choose one of your creatures. If there's nothing at all that Screams from Within can enchant, it remains in your graveyard.

cards.originalText:
Enchanted creature gets -1/-1.
When enchanted creature is put into a graveyard, return Screams from Within from your graveyard to play.

cards.name: Scrounge
cards.text: Target opponent chooses an artifact card in their graveyard. Put that card onto the battlefield under your control.
cards.flavor: When leonin settlers abandon their homes to the nim, items of value are often left behind.
cards.originalText: Target opponent chooses an artifact card in his or her graveyard. Put that card into play under your control.

cards.name: Shriveling Rot
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Until end of turn, whenever a creature is dealt damage, destroy it.
• Until end of turn, whenever a creature dies, that creature's controller loses life equal to its toughness.
Entwine {2}{B} (Choose both if you pay the entwine cost.)
cards.originalText:
Choose one Until end of turn, whenever a creature is dealt damage, destroy it; or until end of turn, whenever a creature is put into a graveyard from play, that creature's controller loses life equal to its toughness.
Entwine {2}{B} (Choose both if you pay the entwine cost.)

cards.name: Barbed Lightning
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Barbed Lightning deals 3 damage to target creature.
• Barbed Lightning deals 3 damage to target player or planeswalker.
Entwine {2} (Choose both if you pay the entwine cost.)
cards.flavor: Every creature on Mirrodin is a lightning rod.
cards.originalText:
Choose one Barbed Lightning deals 3 damage to target creature; or Barbed Lightning deals 3 damage to target player.
Entwine {2} (Choose both if you pay the entwine cost.)

cards.name: Crazed Goblin
cards.text: Crazed Goblin attacks each combat if able.
cards.flavor: Because fighting is easier than figuring out what else to do.
cards.originalText: Crazed Goblin attacks each turn if able.
